project1.title: Patient Tracker
project1.alt: Home page of the dinosaur app
project1.description: Check out this patient-tracking app for the most RAWRsome vet clinic around. This project showcases the vanilla javascript we learned during our Foundations milestone.
project1.technologiesUsed: Bootstrap, CSS, Github (for version control), HTML, JavaScript (vanilla)

project2.title: Battleheart
project2.alt: Home page of the famous band
project2.description: Check out this patient-tracking app for the most RAWRsome vet clinic around. This project showcases the vanilla javascript we learned during our Foundations milestone.
project2.technologiesUsed: Bootstrap, CSS, Github (for version control), HTML, JavaScript (vanilla)

project3.title: Compete
project3.description: Want to track statistics and see the winners? Compete is your app!  It allows park rangers to track brown bear feeding behavior, keep a record of attempts and succeses, and identify the winners. This project is an exploration into using ES6 modules. Bear-y nice!
project3.technologiesUsed: Bootstrap, CSS, ES6 Modules, Github (for version control), HTML, JavaScript (vanilla), JQuery

project4.title: Sundew Smoozer
project4.alt: Messaging app with a sundew flower theme
project4.description: Sundew Smoozer is a messaging app that allows users to select user, send message that gets validated, delete messages, choose dark mode, adjust font-size, and clear all messages.
project4.technologiesUsed: Bootstrap, CSS, ES6 Modules, Github (for version control), HTML, JavaScript (vanilla), JQuery, Sass, Webpack

project5.title: Foodies Unite
project5.alt: Pinterest-like app with a food theme
project5.description: This project is an exploration into using a Firebase database for user authentication and data management. It is a site similar to a much simplified vesion of Pinterest, and it includes meal recommendations for various places around the US and the world.
project5.technologiesUsed: API, Axios, Bootstrap, CSS, ES6 Modules, Firebase (for authentication and data management), Github (for version control), Google login authentication, HTML, JavaScript (vanilla), JQuery, JSON, Lucidchart, moment.js, moqups, Sass, Webpack

project6.title: Travel Diary
project6.description: This project was an opportunity to further hone my skills working with the Firebase database, understanding the relationships between collections and the axios calls necessary to manipulate the data from multiple collections simultaneously.
project6.technologiesUsed: API, Axios, Bootstrap, CSS, ES6 Modules, Firebase, Version Control with Github, HTML, Vanilla JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, Lucidchart, Sass, Webpack

project7.title: Nautilus Explorer
project7.alt: Drawing of the Nautilus submarin interior
project7.description: This group project gave us the opportunity to practice and enhance our understanding of CRUD processes.
project7.technologiesUsed: API, Axios, Bootstrap, CSS, ES6 Modules, Firebase, Version Control with Github, HTML, Vanilla JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, Lucidchart, Sass, Webpack

project8.title: Renaissance Faire
project8.alt: SCreenshot of the Renaissance Faire site
project8.description: This group project gave us the opportunity to better understand how to work with promises and use axios calls to manipulate data in mutliple collections simultaneously. We also got to practice our pair programming skills and proved to be a great group of communicators who shared progress, debugged together, and ensured no one was left behind.
project8.technologiesUsed: API, Axios, Bootstrap, CSS, ES6 Modules, Firebase, Version Control with Github, HTML, Vanilla JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, Lucidchart, Sass, Webpack
